Understate: The claim may understate the extent of road projects that are not staying on track or getting done sooner, as evidenced by the mention of ongoing construction and traffic delays in Milwaukee.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that road projects across the state are staying on track or getting done sooner.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the good work of the team at the Wisconsin Department of Transportation is solely responsible for road projects staying on track or getting done sooner, without considering other factors that may contribute to delays or progress.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for road projects staying on track or getting done sooner, such as increased funding or changes in project management, that are not acknowledged in the claim.
